intro: Honorius libanoticus, commonly known as the Lebanese honor plant, is a flowering shrub native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. Its leaves are finely divided and often used in traditional herbal medicine for their purported health benefits. Honorius libanoticus thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy addition to gardens in temperate climates.
